required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Possible Vertical Transmission of SARS-CoV-2 Through Study of Amniotic Fluid and Chorionic Villi of Affected Pregnant Women for the COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Valuation of the Possible Vertical Transmission of SARS-CoV-2 Through Study of Amniotic Fluid and Chorionic Villi of Affected Pregnant Women for the COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock: Longitudinal prospective study in pregnant women withpositive serology or PCR for SARS-CoV-2 and indicationinvasive technique (amniocentesis or chorionic biopsy) that has the objective to evaluate the possible vertical transmission of SARS-CoV-2in the amniotic fluid or chorionic villi of pregnant women affected by coronavirus in the different periods of gestation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will be recruited at the time theypresent an indication to perform a techniqueinvasive (amniocentesis or chorion biopsy). Eitherscreening for first or second trimester aneuploidies ofhigh risk, due to the presence of fetal malformation, due toearly intrauterine growth retardation (ICR) or due tosuspected chorioamnionitis.
The study population will be pregnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 infection(by PCR on nasopharyngeal aspirate or serology)that have an indication to perform an invasive technique(chorionic biopsy or amniocentesis) along thegestation.The sample size will depend on the duration of theSARS-CoV-2 pandemic.Initially we propose a study period of 18 months in which we would have an approximate total of 225 pregnant women with indication of invasive technique.It is planned to conduct a PCR study for SARS-CoV-2 in amniotic fluid or chorionic villi to those pregnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 infection(approximately 5% of the total pregnant womenwith indication of invasive technique (11-12 pregnant women)).This determination is made as part of theroutine clinical practice in the context of the study ofscreening for perinatal infections.

primary_outcome.description: Presence of SARS-CoV-2 in amniotic fluid or villichorionics from pregnant women with positive serology or PCR in nasopharyngeal aspirate duringgestation

arm_group.description: Pregnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 infection(by PCR on nasopharyngeal aspirate or serology)that have an indication to perform an invasive technique(chorionic biopsy or amniocentesis) along thegestation.The sample size will depend on the duration of theSARS-CoV-2 pandemic.Initially we propose a study period of 18months in which we would have an approximate total of 225pregnant women with indication of invasive technique.It is planned to conduct a PCR study for SARS-CoV-2 in amniotic fluid or chorionic villi to thosepregnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 infection(approximately 5% of the total pregnant womenwith indication of invasive technique (11-12 pregnant women)).This determination is made as part of theroutine clinical practice in the context of the study of screening for perinatal infections

biospec_descr.textblock: umbilical cord blood, samples from the neonatal nasopharynx, the amnio-chorion interface, and placental tissue

study_pop.textblock: regnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 (by PCR in aspiratenasopharyngeal or serologies) that indicate an invasive technique(chorionic biopsy or amniocentesis) throughout pregnancy either due to high riskof aneuploidies in the first or second trimester screening, due to the presence offetal malformation, due to diagnosis of early intrauterine growth retardation (ICR)or for suspected chorioamnionitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 (by PCR in aspiratenasopharyngeal or serologies)
- Patients indicated for an invasive technique(chorionic biopsy or amniocentesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who do not meet the inclusion criteria

facility.name: Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

patient_data.ipd_description: A specific database will be created for the study in which each patient will beAnonymously encoded in such a way that it is not identifiable.The person responsible for database creation, data entry and analysisstatistician will be Dra. Obdulia Alejos Abad.
